meanings.definition: A type of shrub or small tree that produces white flowers in the spring.
meanings.sent1: The shadbushes in the garden bloomed beautifully this spring.
meanings.sent2: We planted shadbushes along the path to add color to the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorns in the shadbushes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a cluster of blooming shadbushes.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the shadbushes filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: The plural form of shadbush, referring to multiple shrubs or small trees of this type.
meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with shadbushes, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: Birds often build nests in shadbushes to protect their eggs.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek among the shadbushes in the park.
meanings.sent4: The valley was a sea of shadbushes, like a blanket of snow in spring.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered secrets as it passed through the shadbushes.
